advisory.name: RLSA-2021:1242
advisory.synopsis: Important: mariadb:10.3 and mariadb-devel:10.3 security update
advisory.topic:
An update for the mariadb:10.3 and mariadb-devel:10.3 modules is now available for Rocky Linux 8.
Rocky Enterprise Software Foundation Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
advisory.description:
MariaDB is a multi-user, multi-threaded SQL database server that is binary compatible with MySQL. 
The following packages have been upgraded to a later upstream version: mariadb (10.3.28), galera (25.3.32).
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

fixes.description: CVE-2021-27928 mariadb: writable system variables allows a database user with SUPER privilege to execute arbitrary code as the system mysql user
